cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northeast across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle, then expected to sweep across Georgia and the coastal Carolinas before reaching the Atlantic Ocean
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle between Panama City and Apalachicola, FL

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coast from northern Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds could reach near tropical-storm force (30–40 mph) Saturday as the center passes nearby.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Only minor coastal inundation (around 1–2 ft) possible along the Georgia coast; major surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Saturday may total 2–4 inches with isolated amounts up to 5 inches around Brunswick.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions for port approaches and anchorages beginning late Friday night through Saturday night.
